clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring Analgesia by ANI (Analgesia The Nociception Index)
clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring Analgesia by ANI (Analgesia The Nociception Index) During Surgery Inflammatory Bowel

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this research is to study the variations of the ANI(Analgesia The Nociception Index) according to 2 periods: the "NoStim" period before surgical incision under general anesthesia and the period of hemodynamic reactivity "ReactHemo" peroperative. This period is defined by a 20% increase in FC and / or PAS (the only gold standard today).

primary_outcome.measure: Change of ANI greater than 20 points
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the surgery, an average Three hours and a half
primary_outcome.description: ANI decrease greater than 20 points between a "NoStim" period before surgical incision under general anesthesia and a period of intraoperative "ReactHemo" hemodynamic reactivity defined by a 20% increase in FC and / or PAS.

intervention.description: experimental medical device using expert rules and continuous reading of heart rate, blood pressure and Analgesia Nociception Index

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient with IBD
- Scheduled surgery: laparotomy or laparoscopic resection with high risk of laparo-conversion
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient included in another current study or the previous month
- urgent surgery
- toxicomania or receiving opioids preoperatively
- pregnant woman
- psychosis
- betablocker treatment
- diabetic dysautonomia
- non-sinus heart rate
- pacemaker heart transplant
